Compare adjclust and adjClustFast

Developed by Gabriel Hoffman

Run on 2021-06-04 11:34:18

Source: vignettes/comparison.Rmd
comparison.Rmd

Simulation code

library(Matrix)
library(adjClustFast)

# Create correlation matrix with autocorrelation
autocorr.mat <- function(p = 100, rho = 0.9) {
    mat <- diag(p)
    return(rho^abs(row(mat)-col(mat)))
}

# Simulate correlation matrix
set.seed(1)
p = 400 # number of features per block
n_blocks = 2^5

# create correlation matrix
Sigma = autocorr.mat(p, .95)
for( i in 1:log2(n_blocks)){
    Sigma = bdiag(Sigma, Sigma)
}

Simulated correlation matrix has 12800 features.

Run adjClust 

# Run adjClust
system.time({
    hcl = adjClust(Sigma, h=3000)
    })
##    user  system elapsed 
##  41.078  21.576  66.841

Run adjClustFast 

# Run adjClustFast
system.time({
    hcl2 = adjClustFast(Sigma, h=3000)
    })
##    user  system elapsed 
##  20.004   1.407  21.817
# test that results are equal
all.equal(hcl, hcl2)
## [1] TRUE
